page.title: 15PADSTOW C.P.SCHOOL
page.content: Padstow County Primary School is just over 100 years old and is built on a site high above the old town with a commanding view of the Camel Estuary. 205 children are taught in 7 classes, averaging 27 pupils per class. There are 6 full-time teachers plus Headmaster and 2 part-time teachers Children come to the school in the Autumn of the year of their 5th birthday and transfer at the age of 11 to Wadebridge Comprehensive School. The subjects taught in the junior school cover the following range of subjects:English Language,Number or Mathematics,History,Geography,Physical Education,Art&Craft,Music and Movement Religious Education,swimming,football, netball and there are opportunities to pursue recorder-playing,gymnastics, guitar,football,rugby and athletics as out of school activities.
